Mark,

I had the exact same problem. If you haven't already solve yours, 
try this: Delete the PYTHON_CMD variable you created, and only add 
c:\Python24 to your path.

Hope that helps,
Mark

--- In cantera@yahoogroups.com, "markscha" <mschaffer@s...> wrote:
> Well, just when I was getting productive, I ran into a problem 
with 
> Cantera/Python.
> 
> I had Cantera working on this XP workstation, but I was trying to 
> install another Python package (gnuplot-py 1.7) when I realized 
that 
> I still had an older version of Python installed (2.3), and this 
was 
> interfering with the gnuplot-py package.  So, I uninstalled the 
2.3 
> version, removed it from my PATH, and viola---Cantera started 
> complaining:  "...could not convert input file to CTML".
> 
> I uninstalled Cantera, Python, Numpy, etc., reboot, re-installed 
> Python, Numpy stuff, and Cantera, and I still get the same thing.
> 
> I am using Cantera 1.5.5 and Python 2.4, etc. (the standard stuff) 
> on a XP workstation.  
> 
> So, am I screwed or what?  I have tried to clean my system several 
> times, and I keep getting the same behavior.  I have verified the 
> file pops up in the correct TMP directory.  I have also tried 
> replaciing the PYTHON_CMD and put c:\Python24 in the PATH.  I have 
> left the directories to be the default values, and I have tried 
some 
> non-defaults.
> 
> Any thoughts?
> 
> -----Mark
> 
> An example Python Traceback follows:
> 
> Traceback (most recent call last):
>   File "C:\Documents and Settings\mas\Desktop\Desktop\Cantera2
> \cantera15\demos\Python\mix1.py", line 25, in ?

in

38, 
> in __init__

>   File "C:\Python24\Lib\site-packages\Cantera\XML.py", line 35, in 
> __init__
>     self._xml_id = _cantera.xml_get_XML_File(src)
> error: 
>
